docs.snippet: Ireland's central bank is making plans in case Britain leaves the European Union and its chief economist said on Wednesday that uncertainly over possible "Brexit" was enough to depress economic growth....
docs.lead_paragraph: Ireland's central bank is making plans in case Britain leaves the European Union and its chief economist said on Wednesday that uncertainly over possible "Brexit" was enough to depress economic growth.

headline.main: Irish Central Bank Planning for Possible 'Brexit'
headline.print_headline: Irish Central Bank Planning for Possible 'Brexit'

docs.snippet: Gibraltar, a rocky British enclave on Spain's southern tip that has positioned itself as a springboard for finance to the European Union, may have to reinvent itself after Britain voted to split from the bloc....

headline.main: Gibraltar Looks to Reinvent Itself After Brexit
headline.print_headline: Gibraltar Looks to Reinvent Itself After Brexit

docs.snippet: British bicycles to car parts retailer Halfords could benefit from the country's vote to leave the European Union if the fall in sterling means more Britons opt to holiday in the UK rather than overseas, its boss said on Thursday....
docs.lead_paragraph: British bicycles to car parts retailer Halfords could benefit from the country's vote to leave the European Union if the fall in sterling means more Britons opt to holiday in the UK rather than overseas, its boss said on Thursday.

headline.main: Halfords Eyes 'Staycation' Boost After Brexit Vote
headline.print_headline: Halfords Eyes 'Staycation' Boost After Brexit Vote

docs.snippet: Ms. May quickly put her stamp on the new government by appointing Mr. Johnson as foreign secretary and Philip Hammond as chancellor of the Exchequer....
docs.lead_paragraph: Ms. May quickly put her stamp on the new government by appointing Mr. Johnson as foreign secretary and Philip Hammond as chancellor of the Exchequer.
docs.abstract: British Prime Min Theresa May names former London Mayor Boris Johnson, vocal advocate for Brexit, as foreign minister; May appoints prominent Euroskeptic David Davis to lead department that will be responsible for country's exit, and Liam Fox as head of international trade.

headline.main: Theresa May, New British Prime Minister, Gives Boris Johnson a Key Post
headline.print_headline: Incoming Prime Minister Appoints ‘Brexit’ Supporters to Key Posts

byline.original: By STEPHEN CASTLE and SEWELL CHAN

docs.snippet: Officially the talk at this week's NATO summit in Warsaw was all about deterring a resurgent Russia, supporting Ukraine and Afghanistan, and protecting Baltic NATO members. But in the corridors, there was only one dominant anxiety - Brexit....
docs.lead_paragraph: Officially the talk at this week's NATO summit in Warsaw was all about deterring a resurgent Russia, supporting Ukraine and Afghanistan, and protecting Baltic NATO members. But in the corridors, there was only one dominant anxiety - Brexit.

headline.main: Brexit Anxiety Eats Into NATO Summit
headline.print_headline: Brexit Anxiety Eats Into NATO Summit

docs.snippet: Some impulses that drove the vote to leave the European Union are at play in the presidential race, but the differences are just as stark....
docs.lead_paragraph: Some impulses that drove the vote to leave the European Union are at play in the presidential race, but the differences are just as stark.
docs.abstract: Many who voted for Great Britain to exit European Union share similar democratic profiles of Donald J Trump's supporters, but while Britain left EU through popular vote, White House race will be determined by Electoral College, which is tilted toward Democrats; no nationalist president hostile to immigration has been elected in recent history, and American presidential elections are largely decided by a diverse and upscale electorate, anchored in America’s cities and suburbs, where support for Trump has fallen short.

headline.main: Is ‘Brexit’ the Precursor to a Donald Trump Presidency? Not So Fast
headline.print_headline: Will Pullout Echo in U.S. Election? Not So Fast

byline.original: By JONATHAN MARTIN and ALEXANDER BURNS

docs.snippet: Britain is expected to submit an application to leave the European Union following Thursday's referendum, after which it would have two years to negotiate an exit....
docs.lead_paragraph: Britain is expected to submit an application to leave the European Union following Thursday's referendum, after which it would have two years to negotiate an exit.

docs.lead_paragraph: Asian stocks slipped on Tuesday amid growing worries this month's referendum in Britain could see it exit the European Union, while markets were also nervous ahead of the U.S. Federal Reserve's two-day meeting that begins later in the day.

headline.main: Asian Shares Slip as Fed, Brexit Loom
headline.print_headline: Asian Shares Slip as Fed, Brexit Loom

docs.snippet: Concerns that Britons would vote to leave the European Union at a June referendum pulled sterling down towards $1.40 and drove it to a fresh seven-year low on Tuesday....
docs.lead_paragraph: Concerns that Britons would vote to leave the European Union at a June referendum pulled sterling down towards $1.40 and drove it to a fresh seven-year low on Tuesday.

headline.main: Sterling Dragged Towards $1.40 by Brexit Concerns
headline.print_headline: Sterling Dragged Towards $1.40 by Brexit Concerns

docs.snippet: Companies are spending millions of dollars to get ready for a British exit from the European Union and, with little idea of what that would look like, are preparing for higher costs and moving their headquarters from Britain....
docs.lead_paragraph: Companies are spending millions of dollars to get ready for a British exit from the European Union and, with little idea of what that would look like, are preparing for higher costs and moving their headquarters from Britain.

headline.main: Companies Spend Millions to Gauge Brexit Impact
headline.print_headline: Companies Spend Millions to Gauge Brexit Impact
